intro: Sophora arenicola, commonly known as the coastal sophora, is a small, deciduous shrub native to coastal regions of China. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically pinnately arranged and have a leathery texture. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by elongated seed pods that contain flat, winged seeds. It is adapted to sandy and saline soils, making it a hardy species found in coastal dunes and rocky shores. Its botanical features make it an important component of coastal ecosystems and a subject of interest in ecological restoration projects.
